item.description:
SOLD OUT

n 1970 Sixto Diaz Rodriguez, an American folk musician from Detroit, released Cold Fact, an album inspired by life, love, poverty and rebellion. The album saw slow sales and mixed reviews, and after trying and seemingly failing again with the album Coming from Reality, Rodriguez disappeared entirely from the public eye. Amid death rumors, Rodriguez and his music were becoming hugely successful on the other side of the world. In South Africa, New Zealand and Australia, Cold Fact went multi-platinum and became a cult classic. Now, at 69 years old, Rodriguez is back and capturing new fans through the critically acclaimed documentary Searching for Sugar Man. He appears solo for a very special performance in the intimate setting of Johnny D’s.

Please secure a ticket before you RSVP.  Searching for Sugar Man just opened in the Boston area, and this concert will sell out very quickly, if it hasn't already.  Johnny D's is a small venue, and this solo performance will be an unforgettable experience.  You can wait until you see the film before purchasing a ticket, but by then, it will probably be too late:  Rodriguez Tickets at Johnny D's

 

 

 

See you at the live performance of the Sugar Man!

 

John
item.how_to_find_us: We will attempt to make dinner reservations so that we can sit together.
item.name: RODRIGUEZ
